Pre-Game Insights: The Indiana Pacers vs Boston Celtics game is a rematch of last season's Eastern Conference Finals and the third meeting of the regular season between the two teams.
The Pacers won the first game 135-132 in overtime on Oct. 30, while the Celtics won the second game 142-105 on Dec. 27.
The Pacers have lost two games in a row after a five-game winning streak from Dec. 13 to Dec. 23.
The Celtics are back to their winning ways after losing two straight games against the Orlando Magic and the Philadelphia 76ers.
Tyrese Haliburton has an over/under of 17.5 points, slightly higher than his season average of 17.4 points per game, but is favored to go under due to his offensive struggles.
Pascal Siakam is averaging 19.9 ppg this season and is favored to go over 18.5 points.
Jayson Tatum is having an MVP-caliber season, averaging 28.7 ppg, with an over/under of 28.5 points but is favored to go under.
Jaylen Brown scored a season-high 44 points against the Pacers on Dec. 27, with an over/under of 25.5 points for the upcoming game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pacers-Celtics game is scheduled to take place at the TD Garden in Boston, Massachusetts at 6:00 p.m. ET and will be televised locally on FanDuel Sports Network Indiana and NBC Sports Boston.
Fans can watch the game via live stream on NBA League Pass and FuboTV, which are paid subscriptions.
The Boston Celtics are the overwhelming favorites to win the game against the Indiana Pacers, with the total score likely going over 233.5 points.
